data.title: Know Before You Go
data.meta_description: Plan your visit to Kemah Boardwalk with essential park information on policies, behavior, attire, food, pets, and parking.
data.text:
In addition to the restrictions mentioned under our Food and Beverage Policy, the following items are not permitted:

Markers, spray paint and aerosol cans.

Knives

Chains

Spiked clothing or jewelry

Fireworks and explosives

Unlicensed possession of a concealed weapon

Chemical weapons including mace or pepper spray

Bicycles, skateboards, rollerblades and surf boards

Kemah Boardwalk is not responsible for items that are stolen or left unattended. All bags, backpacks and packages are subject to inspection if deemed necessary.

Service animals are welcome in most areas of the Kemah Boardwalk at no additional charge. Per the manufacturer, the rides are not equipped or designed to accommodate animals. Therefore, service animals are not permitted on rides, and a member of your party must be available to stay with the animal while the service animal owner enjoys the rides. Guests may take advantage of our policy to allow a member of their party to wait with the service animal while the other guest(s) ride. After the guest (or group of guests) have ridden the ride, the guest who remained with the service animal may enter through the exit and ride on the next available cycle with one (1) accompanying guest. Employees will not take responsibility or provide care for any service animal. Kemah Boardwalk reserves the right to remove any service animal that poses a threat to the safety and/or welfare of the Kemah Boardwalk’s guests, employees, or property.

We have several parking lots on site. Parking lots are paid by CREDIT only. We are not responsible for fire, theft, damage, or loss of vehicle, including articles left within.

We encourage guests to PARK- receive your parking ticket, PAY- scan the QR code sign with your phone or use the walk-up pay stations located on the 1st and 2nd floor of the parking garage, and PLAY- hold onto your ticket to exit out of the lot and enjoy your visit! If you experience any issues, please press the help button on the parking kiosk.

For our GATED parking lots (Bradford and Kipp Ave): parking is FREE when the gate is up. Guests only pay for parking on weekends, holidays, and special events.

For our UN-GATED parking lots (Kipp Ave & 6th St): paid parking is charged 24/7. Please utilize the QR codes posted to pay for parking.

Guests can park in the parking lots on Texas Avenue and take the free shuttle boat to the Kemah Boardwalk on certain days. Shuttle Boat Parking Lots are FREE. Turn onto Texas Avenue from 6th Street. The Shuttle Boat parking lots are just down the road. Please note that the Shuttle Boat does not operate year-round.

Only occupy ONE space. Vehicles parked inappropriately are subject to being towed at the owner’s expense.

Please leave items secure within your vehicle. No tailgating, grilling, or picnics.

Vehicles may not be left overnight.

No bus, tractor-trailer & RV parking in any premium lot. Please park these vehicles in the Texas Avenue lots.

Unauthorized or abandoned vehicles will be towed at the owner’s expense.

No refunds for parking.

No re-entry on parking.

Parking prices vary and are subject to change without notice.

Line jumping is not permitted. To enter a ride queue line guests must have a ticket for that particular ride or be wearing an All Day Ride wristband (or accompanying a child). Guests are not permitted to save places in line, bypass others in line or exit and return to the same place in line for any reason.

We expect riders to act in a responsible manner when participating in amusement rides. Oral and written warnings are provided for your safety and must be followed. Guests who do not comply with ride rules may be ejected without refund. For your convenience, ride rules and guidelines are posted at the entrance to every ride. Transferring wristbands is a violation of Kemah Boardwalk policy and is strictly prohibited.
